ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: That is a most unfair division!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: This is certainly an unjust apportioning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: That is indeed an unfair division!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then that is surely a very unjust distribution!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That indeed is a division most unfair!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: This indeed is an unjust division!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: That were indeed an unjust division.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That indeed were an unfair division!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: That indeed is an unfair division --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That indeed is a division unfair!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: That, then, will be an unfair division!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That indeed is a division most unfair!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: That is indeed an unjust division.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That, then, is an unjust division.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:22] That, then, would indeed be an unfair division! (dīzān, ‘unfair’, derives from dāzahu, yadīzuhu, to mean: ‘he wronged him’, ‘he was unjust to him’).
